00026 // lbann_layer_activations .hpp .cpp - Basic activations: sigmoid, tanh, reLU
00028 
00029 #include "lbann/layers/lbann_layer_activations.hpp"
00030 #include "lbann/utils/lbann_exception.hpp"
00031 
00032 using namespace std;
00033 using namespace El;
00034 
00035 namespace lbann {
00036 
00037 Activation* new_activation(activation_type act_fn) {
00038   switch (act_fn) {
00039   case activation_type::SIGMOID:
00040     return new sigmoid_layer();
00041   case activation_type::TANH:
00042     return new tanh_layer();
00043   case activation_type::RELU:
00044     return new reLU_layer();
00045   case activation_type::ID:
00046     return new id_layer();
00047   default:
00048     throw lbann_exception("Unsupported activation type.");
00049   }
00050   return nullptr;  // Never reached.
00051 }
00052 
00053 // Activation class
00054 DataType sigmoid_layer::sigmoid(DataType z)
00055 {
00056     return (1.0 / (1.0 + exp(-z)));
00057 }
00058 
00059 DataType sigmoid_layer::sigmoidPrime(DataType z)
00060 {
00061     DataType sigz = sigmoid(z);
00062     return sigz * (1 - sigz);
00063 }
00064 
00065 DataType tanh_layer::tanh(DataType z)
00066 {
00067 #ifdef __ICC
00068     // If using Intel compiler, use the MKL specific Tanh function
00069     return Tanh(z);
00070 #else
00071     // Otherwise force the system to use the C++ version - glibc version is having problems with memory leaks
00072     return std::tanh(z);
00073 #endif
00074 }
00075 
00076 DataType tanh_layer::tanhPrime(DataType z)
00077 {
00078     float e = exp(2 * z);
00079     return ((e - 1) / (e + 1));
00080 }
00081 
00082 DataType reLU_layer::reLU(DataType z)
00083 {
00084     return max((DataType) 0.0, z);
00085 }
00086 
00087 DataType reLU_layer::reLUPrime(DataType z)
00088 {
00089     if (z > 0.0) {
00090       return 1.0;
00091     }else {
00092       return 0.0;
00093     }
00094 }
00095 
00097 // There are three mechanisms for updating all fields of a distributed matrix
00098 // 1) EntrywiseMap + independent reset of the bias row - Fastest (about ~30% faster)
00099 // 2) IndexDependentMap (conditional application of function to mask bias row) - Slow
00100 //        IndexDependentMap(m, 
00101 //          (std::function<double(int,int,double)>)[m](int r, int c, double z)->
00102 //          double{int bias_row = m.Height(); 
00103 //                 if(r == bias_row - 1){return 1.0;}else{return sigmoid(z);}
00104 //                 });
00105 // 3) Dual nested loop over local matrix indices with global matrix lookups - Slow
00107 void sigmoid_layer::forwardProp(ElMat& m)
00108 {
00109   EntrywiseMap(m, std::function<DataType(DataType)>(sigmoid));
00110 }
00111 
00112 void sigmoid_layer::backwardProp(ElMat& m)
00113 {
00114   EntrywiseMap(m, std::function<DataType(DataType)>(sigmoidPrime));
00115 }
00116 
00117 void tanh_layer::forwardProp(ElMat& m)
00118 {
00119   EntrywiseMap(m, std::function<DataType(DataType)>(tanh));
00120 }
00121 
00122 void tanh_layer::backwardProp(ElMat& m)
00123 {
00124   EntrywiseMap(m, std::function<DataType(DataType)>(tanhPrime));
00125 }
00126 
00127 void reLU_layer::forwardProp(ElMat& m)
00128 {
00129     EntrywiseMap(m, std::function<DataType(DataType)>(reLU));
00130 }
00131 
00132 void reLU_layer::backwardProp(ElMat& m)
00133 {
00134   EntrywiseMap(m, std::function<DataType(DataType)>(reLUPrime));
00135 }
00136 
00137 }  // namespace lbann
